title.raw: 卷五 景帝紀 Volume 5: Annals of Emperor Jing

sentences.zh: 孝景皇帝，文帝太子也。
母曰竇皇后。
後七年六月，文帝崩。
丁未，太子即皇帝位，尊皇太后薄氏曰太皇太后，皇后曰皇太后。

translations.literal: Emperor Jing was Emperor Wen's crown prince. His mother was Empress Dou. In the seventh year, sixth month, Emperor Wen passed away. On the ding-wei day, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne. He honored Empress Dowager Bo as Grand Empress Dowager and the Empress as Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 九月，有星孛于西方。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, a comet appeared in the west.

sentences.zh: 元年冬十月，詔曰：「蓋聞古者祖有功而宗有德，制禮樂各有由。
歌者，所以發德也；
舞者，所以明功 也。
高廟酎，奏武德、文始、五行之舞。
孝惠廟酎，奏文始、五行之舞。
孝文皇帝臨天下，通關梁，不異遠方；
除誹謗，去肉刑，賞賜長老，收恤孤獨，以遂群生；
減耆欲，不受獻，罪人不帑，不誅亡罪，不私其利也；
除宮刑，出美人，重絕人之世也。
朕既不敏，弗能勝識。
此皆上世之所不及，而孝文皇帝親行之。
德厚侔天 地，利澤施四海，靡不獲福。
明象乎日月，而廟樂不稱，朕甚懼焉。
其為孝文皇帝廟為昭德之舞，以明休德。
然后祖宗之功德，施于萬世，永永無窮，朕甚嘉之。
其 與丞相、列侯、中二千石、禮官具禮儀奏。」
丞相臣嘉等奏曰：「陛下永思孝道，立昭德之舞以明孝文皇帝之盛德，皆臣嘉等愚所不及。
臣謹議：世功莫大於高皇 帝，德莫盛於孝文皇帝。
高皇帝廟宜為帝者太祖之廟，孝文皇帝廟宜為帝諸太宗之廟。
天子宜世世獻祖宗之廟。
郡國諸侯宜各為孝文皇帝立太宗之廟。
諸侯王列侯使 者侍祠天子所獻祖宗之廟。
請宣布天下。」
制曰「可」。

translations.literal: In the first year, winter, tenth month, an edict declared: 'I have heard that in ancient times, ancestors were honored for their merit and ancestral temples established for their virtue. The establishment of ritual and music each had their origins.' Singers express virtue; dancers clarify merit.' At the Gao Temple autumn sacrifice, perform the Martial Virtue, Literary Beginning, and Five Phases dances. At the Xiaohui Temple autumn sacrifice, perform the Literary Beginning and Five Phases dances. In spring, first month, an edict declared: 'Agriculture is the foundation of the realm. No duty is greater.' Order the commanderies and kingdoms to diligently encourage farming and sericulture, increase planting of trees, so that clothing and food may be obtained.' Order the regional kings, marquises, and officials of 2000 shi to share in labor with the people.' In summer, fourth month, yi-mao day, he granted amnesty to the realm. On ding-you day, he granted amnesty to the realm. In the fifth month, an edict declared: 'Commend filial piety, fraternal duty, and working the fields. Call them "Three Elders," "Filial and Fraternal," "Working the Fields." Each receives five bolts of silk.' Order the imperial secretaries: 'Inspect and recommend from the Three Adjuncts, Three Rivers, and Hongnong two each of "Three Elders," "Filial and Fraternal," "Working the Fields." Order the Chancellor and Imperial Secretaries to examine them according to the laws and ordinances.' In the sixth month, an edict declared: 'The carriages, riders, and horses are not complete. Order the realm to provide one horse and one chariot team.' In autumn, seventh month, an edict declared: 'If officials receive their subordinates but do not restrain them with law, then they become negligent and corrupt officials accomplish their private interests.' They receive punishment for perverting the law, or escape through affairs, or flee through wealth.' Now I continue to receive the imperial seal and ascend the throne. I follow the former kings' regulations, examine ancient and modern practices, change the laws, ease punishments, eliminate burdensome taxes, lighten corvee labor, eliminate hateful and evil things, and promote the filial and worthy.' I wish to make the people peaceful, officials not corrupt, superiors and inferiors harmonious, ghosts and spirits joyful, and prevent disasters and calamities from arising.' However, the people are not yet transformed, officials are not yet enlightened, prisons are not yet empty, lawsuits are not yet few, corvee is not yet light, taxes are not yet few, officials are not yet sufficient, people are not yet rich.' This is because my virtue is not yet bright, my teaching has not yet reached them, my governance is not yet perfected.' I am frightened and fearful, not knowing where to begin.' I have heard that in ancient times, the people were few and affairs were simple. Superiors were easy to serve, subordinates were easy to govern. Materials were sufficient for use, people were sufficient for labor.' Therefore the people were happy in their places, joyful in their occupations. The old and young had their proper places, men and women had their proper ways.' Evil and wickedness did not arise, litigation did not occur. The strong did not oppress the weak, the many did not bully the few. The orphaned and widowed were cared for, the poor and destitute were supported.' This was the beauty of the utmost governance.'

sentences.zh: 春正月，詔曰：「間者歲比不登，民多乏食，夭絕天年，朕甚痛之。
郡國或磽骥，無所農桑诒畜；
或地饒廣，薦草莽，水泉利，而不得徙。
其議民欲徙寬大地者，聽之。」

translations.literal: Now the people are numerous and affairs are complicated. Superiors are difficult to serve, subordinates are difficult to govern. Materials are insufficient for use, people are insufficient for labor.' Therefore the people are anxious in their places, resentful in their occupations. The old and young lose their proper places, men and women lose their proper ways.' Evil and wickedness arise together, litigation occurs frequently. The strong oppress the weak, the many bully the few. The orphaned and widowed are not cared for, the poor and destitute are not supported.' This is the calamity of the utmost disorder.'

sentences.zh: 夏四月，赦天下。
賜民爵一級。

translations.literal: I am not talented, my virtue is shallow and thin. I cannot make the people return to the ancient ways.' I will examine the current situation, follow what is suitable, change what is harmful, promote what is beneficial, abolish what is wasteful.'

sentences.zh: 遣御史大夫青翟至代下與匈奴和親。

translations.literal: I will make officials enlightened and not confused, the people transformed and not disordered, superiors and inferiors united in heart, inside and outside harmonized.'

sentences.zh: 五月，令田半租。

translations.literal: Then the ancestral temples will be secure, the altars of soil and grain peaceful, ghosts and spirits joyful, disasters and calamities will not arise.'

sentences.zh: 秋七月，詔曰：「吏受所監臨，以飲食免，重；
受財物，賤買貴賣，論輕。
廷尉與丞相更議著令。」
廷尉 信謹與丞相議曰：「吏及諸有秩受其官屬所監、所治、所行、所將，其與飲食計償費，勿論。
它物，若買故賤，賣故貴，皆坐臧為盜，沒入臧縣官。
吏遷徙免罷，受 其故官屬所將監治送財物，奪爵為士伍，免之。
無爵，罰金二斤，令沒入所受。
有能捕告，畀其所受臧。」

translations.literal: This is the constant way of the former kings, the great plan of governing the realm.' I will begin with the fundamental, make agriculture the priority, eliminate the secondary, stop the wasteful, prohibit the extravagant, prevent luxury.' Make the people diligent in their fundamentals, few in their desires, sufficient in food and clothing, joyful in their occupations.' Make the old and young have their proper support, men and women have their proper occupations.' Then the people will be transformed by the prevailing customs, morals will be pure, prisons will be empty, the world will be peaceful.' This is the way of the former kings, the accomplishment of great governance.' I am not enlightened. I cannot reach this alone.' I will rely on the three dukes, nine ministers, regional kings, marquises, officials of 2000 shi, scholars, and common people.'

translations.literal: Each according to their office, diligently perform their duties, examine the current situation, offer what is beneficial, stop what is harmful.'

sentences.zh: 令天下男子年二十始傅。

translations.literal: Then my virtue will be bright, teaching will reach far, governance will be perfected.'

translations.literal: If the people are diligent in farming and sericulture, then superiors have enough to eat, inferiors have enough to wear, the national treasury is sufficient, the people are rich.'

translations.literal: If they leave the fundamentals and pursue the secondary, then superiors lack food, inferiors lack clothing, the national treasury is depleted, the people are poor.'

sentences.zh: 三年冬十二月，詔曰：「襄平侯嘉子恢說不孝，謀反，欲以殺嘉，大逆無道。
其赦嘉為襄平侯，及妻子當坐者復故爵。
論恢說及妻子如法。」

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings valued the farmer, honored the fundamental, despised the merchant, humiliated the secondary.' Now I hear that in the commanderies and kingdoms, the powerful and noble, officials and people, some leave farming and engage in profit, pursue the secondary and despise the fundamental.' This is the way to deplete the national treasury and impoverish the people.'

translations.literal: I am greatly pained by this.'

sentences.zh: 諸將破七國，斬首十餘萬級。

膠西王卬、楚王戊、趙王遂、濟南王辟光、菑川王賢、 膠東王雄渠皆自殺。
夏六月，詔曰：「乃者吳王濞等為逆，起兵相脅，詿誤吏民，吏民不得已。
今濞等已滅，吏民當坐濞等及逋逃亡軍者，皆赦之。
楚元王子蓺等與 濞等為逆，朕不忍加法，除其籍，毋令汙宗室。」
立平陸侯劉禮為楚王，續元王後。
立皇子端為膠西王，勝為中山王。

translations.literal: In winter, twelfth month, a comet appeared in the southwest. In the third year, spring, first month, an edict declared: 'The way of Yao and Shun was to have the people rich and officials few.' This is the utmost virtue, the great accomplishment.' Now officials are numerous, the people poor. This is not the way.' I will reduce officials, ease burdens, make the people rich.' Order the Chancellor and Imperial Secretary to discuss and establish the number.'' In summer, fourth month, he granted amnesty to the realm. In autumn, the Xiongnu entered Yanmen, killed the prefect, and captured people. He sent General Zhang Wu to attack them.

人有智愚，官有上下。
獄疑者讞有司。
有司所不能決，移廷尉。

欲令治獄者務先寬。」

People have wisdom and foolishness, officials have superiors and inferiors.' For doubtful prison cases, have officials judge them.' What officials cannot decide, transfer to the Court Minister.' Have command to judge then afterward not proper, the judgers are not considered to have lost.' I wish to make those who govern prisons strive first to be lenient.'' In the third month, he granted amnesty to the realm, granted the people nobility one level, and granted middle 2000 shi officials and regional kings' chancellors the nobility rank of right grand master. In summer, there was a great gathering for five days, during which the people were permitted to sell wine.

sentences.zh: 五月，地震。
秋七月乙巳晦，日有蝕之。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, there was an earthquake. In autumn, seventh month, on the yi-si last day, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 條侯周亞夫下獄死。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Tiaohou, Zhou Yafu, was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 二年冬十月，省徹侯之國。

translations.literal: In the second year, spring, first month, an edict declared: 'The way of Yao and Shun was to have the people rich and officials few.'

sentences.zh: 春，匈奴入鴈門，太守馮敬與戰死。
發車騎材官屯。

translations.literal: This is the utmost virtue, the great accomplishment.' Now officials are numerous, the people poor. This is not the way.'

sentences.zh: 春，以歲不登，禁內郡食馬粟，沒入之。

translations.literal: I will reduce officials, ease burdens, make the people rich.'

sentences.zh: 夏四月，詔曰：「雕文刻鏤，傷農事者也；
錦繡纂組，害女紅者也。
農事傷則飢之本也，女紅害則寒之原 也。
夫飢寒並至，而能亡為非者寡矣。
朕親耕，后親桑，以奉宗廟粢盛祭服，為天下先；
不受獻，減太官，省繇賦，欲天下務農蠶，素有畜積，以備災害。
彊毋攘 弱，眾毋暴寡，老耆以壽終，幼孤得遂長。
今歲或不登，民食頗寡，其咎安在？
或詐偽為吏，吏以貨賂為市，漁奪百姓，侵牟萬民。
縣丞，長吏也，奸法與盜盜，甚 無謂也。
其令二千石修其職；
不事官職耗亂者，丞相以聞，請其罪。
布告天下，使明知朕意。」

In autumn, seventh month, a comet appeared in the southwest. In winter, twelfth month, a comet appeared in the southwest. In the third year, spring, first month, an edict declared: 'Agriculture is the foundation of the realm, the root of the people, the beginning of officials.' If the people are diligent in farming and sericulture, then superiors have enough to eat, inferiors have enough to wear, the national treasury is sufficient, the people are rich.' If they leave the fundamentals and pursue the secondary, then superiors lack food, inferiors lack clothing, the national treasury is depleted, the people are poor.' Therefore the former kings valued the farmer, honored the fundamental, despised the merchant, humiliated the secondary.' Now I hear that in the commanderies and kingdoms, the powerful and noble, officials and people, some leave farming and engage in profit, pursue the secondary and despise the fundamental.' This is the way to deplete the national treasury and impoverish the people.' I am greatly pained by this.' Order the commanderies and kingdoms to strictly prohibit this, make the people return to farming.' If the powerful and noble violate the prohibition, the officials who oversee them will be punished.'

sentences.zh: 五月，詔曰：「人不患其不知，患其為詐也；
不患其不勇，患其為暴也；
不患其不富，患其亡厭也。
其唯廉士，寡欲易足。
今訾算十以上乃得宦，廉士算不必眾。
有市籍不得宦，無訾又不得宦，朕甚愍之。
訾算四得宦，亡令廉士久失職，貪夫長利。」

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings valued the farmer, honored the fundamental, despised the merchant, humiliated the secondary.'

sentences.zh: 三年春正月，詔曰：「農，天下之本也。
黃金珠玉，飢不可食，寒不可衣，以為幣用，不識其終始。
間歲或不登，意為末者眾，農民寡也。
其令郡國務勸農桑，益種樹，可得衣食物。
吏發民若取庸采黃金珠玉者，坐臧為盜。
二千石聽者，與同罪。」

translations.literal: Now I hear that in the commanderies and kingdoms, the powerful and noble, officials and people, some leave farming and engage in profit, pursue the secondary and despise the fundamental.' This is the way to deplete the national treasury and impoverish the people.' I am greatly pained by this.' Order the commanderies and kingdoms to strictly prohibit this, make the people return to farming.' If the powerful and noble violate the prohibition, the officials who oversee them will be punished.' Officials of 2000 shi who listen share the same crime.''

sentences.zh: 皇太子冠，賜民為父後者爵一級。

translations.literal: The crown prince was capped. He granted nobility one level to those who succeed their fathers.

sentences.zh: 甲子，帝崩于未央宮。
遺詔賜諸侯王列侯馬二駟，吏二千石黃金二斤，吏民戶百錢。
出宮人歸其家，復終身。
二月癸酉，葬陽陵。

translations.literal: On the jiazi day, the emperor collapsed in Weiyang Palace. By bequeathed edict, he granted each regional king and marquis two teams of horses, each official of 2000 shi two jin of gold, and each household of officials and people one hundred cash. He released the palace people to return to their homes and exempted them for life. In the second month, on the gui-you day, he was buried at Yangling.

sentences.zh: 贊曰：孔子稱「斯民，三代之所以直道而行也」，信哉！
周秦之敝，罔密文峻，而姦軌不勝。
漢興，掃除煩苛，與民休息。
至于孝文，加之以恭儉，孝景遵業，五六十載之間，至於移風易俗，黎民醇厚。
周云成康，漢言文景，美矣！

translations.literal: The commentator says: Confucius said 'These people—the three dynasties used them to walk the straight way.' Truly! The decay of Zhou and Qin, nets dense and writings severe, yet wicked tracks could not be overcome. Han arose, swept away troubles and harshness, gave the people rest. Until Xiaowen, who added reverence and frugality; Xiaojing followed the enterprise. Within five or six decades, they reached changing customs and transforming habits, making the black-haired people pure and thick. Zhou speaks of Cheng and Kang, Han speaks of Wen and Jing—beautiful indeed!
